question: Þa cwæð God nis na gedafenlic þæt (þes) #### man ana beo⁠ — Then God said 'it is not fitting that this man be alone'
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular masculine nominative 'man' so it stays as 'þes'

question: Þa gefæstnode he (þes) #### ræd wið þæt werod þe he bewiste, and hie ealle to ðam ræde gebugon⁠ — Then he confirmed this resolve with the host over which he ruled, and they all bowed to that resolve
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular masculine accusative 'ræd' so it becomes 'þisne'

question: Ac se wurðmynt wæs (þes) #### dæges mærðe gehealden, þæt hie mid heofenlicum leohte hie geswutelodon⁠ — But that honour was reserved for the greatness of this day, that they should manifest themselves with heavenly light
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular masculine genitive 'dæg' so it becomes 'þisses'

question: Ic wille þæt þu giefe þone mete (þes) #### bearnum — I wish that you would give the food to these children.
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural neuter dative 'bearn' so it becomes 'þissum'

question: On Godes naman ahreose (þis) #### templ mid eallum þæm deofolgyldum þe him on eardiað⁠ — In the name of God, let this temple fall with all the idols that dwell within it
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular neuter nominative 'templ' so it becomes 'þis'

question: Nim (þis) #### cild mid þære modor and fleoh to Egypta lande⁠ — Take this child with the mother and flee to Egypt
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular neuter accusative 'cild' so it becomes 'þis'

question: Adam þa wæs wunigende on (þis) #### life mid geswince, and he and his wif ða bearn gestryndon⁠ — Adam then was continuing in this life with toil, and he and his wife begat children
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular neuter dative 'life' so it becomes 'þissum'

question: Widewe wæs (þeos) #### Anna, þe we gefyrn ær embe spræcon⁠ — This Anna was a widow who we have spoken of before
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular feminine nominative 'Anna' so it becomes 'þeos'

commonMistakes.explanation: Though the word order is confusing, Anna is the subject, not the object of 'wæs' so it takes the singular nominative feminine 'þeos'

question: Send me þinne engel on fyrenum wolcne þæt þa embgange ealle (þeos) #### ceastre — Send me your angel from heaven in a fiery cloud that he my encompass all this city
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular feminine accusative 'ceaster' so it becomes 'þas'

question: Þæt sædon gehwilce wise lareowas þæt hie habbað gefremod heora ærist to ðæm ecan lífe swa swa we ealle don scoldon on ende (þeos) #### worulde⁠ — All wise teachers have said that they have effected their resurrection to eternal life, as we all shall do at the end of this world
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular feminine genitive 'worulde' so it becomes 'þisse'

question: Oft ys seo halige þrinnys geswutelod on (þeos) #### boc⁠ — Often is the holy trinity revealed in this book
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the singular feminine dative 'boc' so it becomes 'þisse'

question: (þis) #### ðing we ne magon don butan earfoðnyssum⁠ — These things we cannot do without difficulty
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural neuter nominative 'ðing' so it becomes 'þas'

question: Nimað þis gold ond (þis) #### gymstanas ond farað ond bicgað eow landare⁠ — Take this gold and these gemstones and go and buy yourself land
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural neuter accusative 'gymstan' so it becomes 'þas'

question: (þis) #### writa sind þreo — There are three of these documents
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural neuter genitive 'writa' so it becomes 'þissa'

question: þa leode (þeos) #### ieglanda sindon eaþmod — The people of these islands are humble
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural feminine dative 'ieglanda' so it becomes 'þissa'

question: (þeos) #### læssan giefa þæt sind þa fugelas þe wæron wannspedigra manna giefa wæron for Criste geoffrode⁠ — These smaller gifts, that is the birds which were the gifts of indigent persons, were offered for Christ
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural feminine nominative 'giefu' so it becomes 'þas'

question: On ðære ealdan æ is gehwær gesett, þæt God het gelomlice (þes) #### fugelas offrian on his lace⁠ — In the old law it is in several places mentioned, that God frequently commanded these birds to be offered to him in sacrifice
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural masculine accusative 'fugel' so it becomes 'þas'

question: Eala hu rihtlice hie andetton þone halgan geleafan mid (þis) #### wordum: On frymðe wæs word, and þæt word wæs mid Gode⁠ — O how rightly they acknowledged the holy faith with these words, 'In the beginning was the word, and the word was with God'
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural neuter dative 'word' so it becomes 'þissum'

question: Gif ðu Godes Sunu sy wend (þes) #### stanas to hlafum ond et⁠ — If you are the son of god, turn these stones to loaves and eat
explanation: Here 'þes' is modifying the plural masculine accusative 'gymstan' so it becomes 'þas'
